      • performUserActivity

        public void performUserActivity(java.lang.Runnable activity)
        An absolutely guru method!

        Executes the given code and marks it as a user activity, to allow write actions to be run without requiring transactions. This is only to be called from UI infrastructure, during InputEvent processing and wrap the point where the control goes to custom input event handlers for the first time.

        If you wish to invoke some actionPerformed, please consider using ActionManager.tryToExecute() instead, or ensure in some other way that the action is enabled and can be invoked in the current modality state.

      • startActivity

        public AccessToken startActivity(boolean userActivity)
        An absolutely guru method, only intended to be used from Swing event processing. Please consult Peter if you think you need to invoke this.

      • isWritingAllowed

        public boolean isWritingAllowed()
        Description copied from class: TransactionGuard
        Checks whether the current state allows for writing the model. Must be called from write thread.
        Specified by:
        isWritingAllowed in class TransactionGuard
        Returns:
        true is current context is write-safe, false otherwise

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • assertWriteActionAllowed

      • assertWriteSafeContext

        public void assertWriteSafeContext(ModalityState modality)
        Description copied from class: TransactionGuard
        Logs an error if the given modality state was created in a write-unsafe context. For modalities created in write-safe contexts, Application.invokeLater(Runnable, ModalityState) and similar calls will be guaranteed to also run in a write-safe context. ModalityState.NON_MODAL is always write-safe, ModalityState.any() is always write-unsafe.
        Specified by:
        assertWriteSafeContext in class TransactionGuard
